flawed_nl_solution:
Johnny spends 6/3=2 hours walking the 6 dogs who have 60-minute walks.
He makes $20*6=$<<20*6=120>>120 for these walks.
Thus, he has 4-2=2 hours=210 minutes left to walk the other dogs.
He can walk 3*(210/30)=<<3*(210/30)=21>>21 dogs in this time.
Thus, he will make $15*21=$<<21*15=315>>315 on these walks.
In total per day, he makes $120+$315=$<<120+315=435>>435 per day.
Thus, during the week, he makes $435*5=$<<435*5=2175>>2175.
#### 2175

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 120, not 210. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
